Title: Rivian Balance Sheet Analysis - Chapter 3 Complete
Content:
Chapter 3 Balance Sheet Analysis for Rivian Automotive Inc. - Complete calculations for Questions 11-14:

Q11 - Common-Sized Balance Sheet:
2023: Current Assets 73.39%, Non-Current Assets 26.61%, Current Liabilities 32.56%, Non-Current Liabilities 67.44%, Equity 54.49%
2024: Current Assets 68.67%, Non-Current Assets 31.33%, Current Liabilities 25.44%, Non-Current Liabilities 74.56%, Equity 42.58%

Q12 - Major Changes Analysis:
- Equity declined 11.91pp due to $4.7B net loss increasing accumulated deficit
- Current assets declined 4.72pp due to cash reduction from $7.9B to $5.3B
- Non-current liabilities increased 7.12pp due to VW partnership and customer advances

Q13 - Liquidity Ratios:
2023: Current Ratio 4.95, Quick Ratio 4.28, Cash Ratio 3.18
2024: Current Ratio 4.70, Quick Ratio 3.84, Cash Ratio 2.36
All ratios remain strong but declining trend

Q14 - Leverage Ratios:
2023: Debt-to-Equity 0.84, Debt-to-Assets 0.46
2024: Debt-to-Equity 1.35, Debt-to-Assets 0.57
Leverage increasing significantly

All calculations verified with detailed proof.
